ARABIC_TEXT: كٓهيعٓصٓ
TRANSLATION: (1) Kāf, Hā, Yā, ʿAyn, Ṣād.[806]
FOOTNOTES: [806]- See footnote to 2:1.

ARABIC_TEXT: ذِكۡرُ رَحۡمَتِ رَبِّكَ عَبۡدَهُۥ زَكَرِيَّآ
TRANSLATION: (2) [This is] a mention of the mercy of your Lord to His servant Zechariah

ARABIC_TEXT: إِذۡ نَادَىٰ رَبَّهُۥ نِدَآءً خَفِيّٗا
TRANSLATION: (3) When he called to his Lord a private call [i.e., supplication].

ARABIC_TEXT: قَالَ رَبِّ إِنِّي وَهَنَ ٱلۡعَظۡمُ مِنِّي وَٱشۡتَعَلَ ٱلرَّأۡسُ شَيۡبٗا وَلَمۡ أَكُنۢ بِدُعَآئِكَ رَبِّ شَقِيّٗا
TRANSLATION: (4) He said, "My Lord, indeed my bones have weakened, and my head has filled[807] with white, and never have I been in my supplication to You, my Lord, unhappy [i.e., disappointed].
FOOTNOTES: [807]- Literally, "ignited."  The spread of white hair throughout the head is likened to that of fire in the bush.

ARABIC_TEXT: وَإِنِّي خِفۡتُ ٱلۡمَوَٰلِيَ مِن وَرَآءِي وَكَانَتِ ٱمۡرَأَتِي عَاقِرٗا فَهَبۡ لِي مِن لَّدُنكَ وَلِيّٗا
TRANSLATION: (5) And indeed, I fear the successors[808] after me, and my wife has been barren, so give me from Yourself an heir
FOOTNOTES: [808]- Those relatives from the father's side who would inherit religious authority.

ARABIC_TEXT: يَرِثُنِي وَيَرِثُ مِنۡ ءَالِ يَعۡقُوبَۖ وَٱجۡعَلۡهُ رَبِّ رَضِيّٗا
TRANSLATION: (6) Who will inherit me[809] and inherit from the family of Jacob. And make him, my Lord, pleasing [to You]."
FOOTNOTES: [809]- Inherit from me religious knowledge and prophethood.

ARABIC_TEXT: يَٰزَكَرِيَّآ إِنَّا نُبَشِّرُكَ بِغُلَٰمٍ ٱسۡمُهُۥ يَحۡيَىٰ لَمۡ نَجۡعَل لَّهُۥ مِن قَبۡلُ سَمِيّٗا
TRANSLATION: (7) [He was told],[810] "O Zechariah, indeed We give you good tidings of a boy whose name will be John. We have not assigned to any before [this] name."
FOOTNOTES: [810]- By Allāh (subḥānahu wa taʿālā) through the angels.

ARABIC_TEXT: قَالَ رَبِّ أَنَّىٰ يَكُونُ لِي غُلَٰمٞ وَكَانَتِ ٱمۡرَأَتِي عَاقِرٗا وَقَدۡ بَلَغۡتُ مِنَ ٱلۡكِبَرِ عِتِيّٗا
TRANSLATION: (8) He said, "My Lord, how will I have a boy when my wife has been barren and I have reached extreme old age?"

ARABIC_TEXT: قَالَ كَذَٰلِكَ قَالَ رَبُّكَ هُوَ عَلَيَّ هَيِّنٞ وَقَدۡ خَلَقۡتُكَ مِن قَبۡلُ وَلَمۡ تَكُ شَيۡـٔٗا
TRANSLATION: (9) [An angel] said, "Thus [it will be]; your Lord says, 'It is easy for Me, for I created you before, while you were nothing.'"

ARABIC_TEXT: قَالَ رَبِّ ٱجۡعَل لِّيٓ ءَايَةٗۖ قَالَ ءَايَتُكَ أَلَّا تُكَلِّمَ ٱلنَّاسَ ثَلَٰثَ لَيَالٖ سَوِيّٗا
TRANSLATION: (10) [Zechariah] said, "My Lord, make for me a sign." He said, "Your sign is that you will not speak to the people for three nights, [being] sound."[811]
FOOTNOTES: [811]- i.e., without illness or defect.

ARABIC_TEXT: فَخَرَجَ عَلَىٰ قَوۡمِهِۦ مِنَ ٱلۡمِحۡرَابِ فَأَوۡحَىٰٓ إِلَيۡهِمۡ أَن سَبِّحُواْ بُكۡرَةٗ وَعَشِيّٗا
TRANSLATION: (11) So he came out to his people from the prayer chamber and signaled to them to exalt [Allāh] in the morning and afternoon.

ARABIC_TEXT: يَٰيَحۡيَىٰ خُذِ ٱلۡكِتَٰبَ بِقُوَّةٖۖ وَءَاتَيۡنَٰهُ ٱلۡحُكۡمَ صَبِيّٗا
TRANSLATION: (12) [Allāh said], "O John, take the Scripture [i.e., adhere to it] with determination." And We gave him judgement [while yet] a boy

ARABIC_TEXT: وَحَنَانٗا مِّن لَّدُنَّا وَزَكَوٰةٗۖ وَكَانَ تَقِيّٗا
TRANSLATION: (13) And affection from Us and purity, and he was fearing of Allāh

ARABIC_TEXT: وَبَرَّۢا بِوَٰلِدَيۡهِ وَلَمۡ يَكُن جَبَّارًا عَصِيّٗا
TRANSLATION: (14) And dutiful to his parents, and he was not a disobedient tyrant.

ARABIC_TEXT: وَسَلَٰمٌ عَلَيۡهِ يَوۡمَ وُلِدَ وَيَوۡمَ يَمُوتُ وَيَوۡمَ يُبۡعَثُ حَيّٗا
TRANSLATION: (15) And peace be upon him the day he was born and the day he dies and the day he is raised alive.

ARABIC_TEXT: وَٱذۡكُرۡ فِي ٱلۡكِتَٰبِ مَرۡيَمَ إِذِ ٱنتَبَذَتۡ مِنۡ أَهۡلِهَا مَكَانٗا شَرۡقِيّٗا
TRANSLATION: (16) And mention, [O Muḥammad], in the Book [the story of] Mary, when she withdrew from her family to a place toward the east.

ARABIC_TEXT: فَٱتَّخَذَتۡ مِن دُونِهِمۡ حِجَابٗا فَأَرۡسَلۡنَآ إِلَيۡهَا رُوحَنَا فَتَمَثَّلَ لَهَا بَشَرٗا سَوِيّٗا
TRANSLATION: (17) And she took, in seclusion from them, a screen. Then We sent to her Our Angel [i.e., Gabriel], and he represented himself to her as a well-proportioned man.

ARABIC_TEXT: قَالَتۡ إِنِّيٓ أَعُوذُ بِٱلرَّحۡمَٰنِ مِنكَ إِن كُنتَ تَقِيّٗا
TRANSLATION: (18) She said, "Indeed, I seek refuge in the Most Merciful from you, [so leave me], if you should be fearing of Allāh."

ARABIC_TEXT: قَالَ إِنَّمَآ أَنَا۠ رَسُولُ رَبِّكِ لِأَهَبَ لَكِ غُلَٰمٗا زَكِيّٗا
TRANSLATION: (19) He said, "I am only the messenger of your Lord to give you [news of] a pure boy [i.e., son]."

ARABIC_TEXT: قَالَتۡ أَنَّىٰ يَكُونُ لِي غُلَٰمٞ وَلَمۡ يَمۡسَسۡنِي بَشَرٞ وَلَمۡ أَكُ بَغِيّٗا
TRANSLATION: (20) She said, "How can I have a boy while no man has touched me and I have not been unchaste?"

ARABIC_TEXT: قَالَ كَذَٰلِكِ قَالَ رَبُّكِ هُوَ عَلَيَّ هَيِّنٞۖ وَلِنَجۡعَلَهُۥٓ ءَايَةٗ لِّلنَّاسِ وَرَحۡمَةٗ مِّنَّاۚ وَكَانَ أَمۡرٗا مَّقۡضِيّٗا
TRANSLATION: (21) He said, "Thus [it will be]; your Lord says, 'It is easy for Me, and We will make him a sign to the people and a mercy from Us. And it is a matter [already] decreed.'"

ARABIC_TEXT: ۞ فَحَمَلَتۡهُ فَٱنتَبَذَتۡ بِهِۦ مَكَانٗا قَصِيّٗا
TRANSLATION: (22) So she conceived him, and she withdrew with him to a remote place.

ARABIC_TEXT: فَأَجَآءَهَا ٱلۡمَخَاضُ إِلَىٰ جِذۡعِ ٱلنَّخۡلَةِ قَالَتۡ يَٰلَيۡتَنِي مِتُّ قَبۡلَ هَٰذَا وَكُنتُ نَسۡيٗا مَّنسِيّٗا
TRANSLATION: (23) And the pains of childbirth drove her to the trunk of a palm tree. She said, "Oh, I wish I had died before this and was in oblivion, forgotten."

ARABIC_TEXT: فَنَادَىٰهَا مِن تَحۡتِهَآ أَلَّا تَحۡزَنِي قَدۡ جَعَلَ رَبُّكِ تَحۡتَكِ سَرِيّٗا
TRANSLATION: (24) But he[812] called her from below her, "Do not grieve; your Lord has provided beneath you a stream.
FOOTNOTES: [812]- There is a difference of opinion among scholars as to whether "he" refers to the baby or to the angel.

ARABIC_TEXT: وَهُزِّيٓ إِلَيۡكِ بِجِذۡعِ ٱلنَّخۡلَةِ تُسَٰقِطۡ عَلَيۡكِ رُطَبٗا جَنِيّٗا
TRANSLATION: (25) And shake toward you the trunk of the palm tree; it will drop upon you ripe, fresh dates.

ARABIC_TEXT: فَكُلِي وَٱشۡرَبِي وَقَرِّي عَيۡنٗاۖ فَإِمَّا تَرَيِنَّ مِنَ ٱلۡبَشَرِ أَحَدٗا فَقُولِيٓ إِنِّي نَذَرۡتُ لِلرَّحۡمَٰنِ صَوۡمٗا فَلَنۡ أُكَلِّمَ ٱلۡيَوۡمَ إِنسِيّٗا
TRANSLATION: (26) So eat and drink and be contented. And if you see from among humanity anyone, say, 'Indeed, I have vowed to the Most Merciful abstention, so I will not speak today to [any] man.'"

ARABIC_TEXT: فَأَتَتۡ بِهِۦ قَوۡمَهَا تَحۡمِلُهُۥۖ قَالُواْ يَٰمَرۡيَمُ لَقَدۡ جِئۡتِ شَيۡـٔٗا فَرِيّٗا
TRANSLATION: (27) Then she brought him to her people, carrying him. They said, "O Mary, you have certainly done a thing unprecedented.

ARABIC_TEXT: يَٰٓأُخۡتَ هَٰرُونَ مَا كَانَ أَبُوكِ ٱمۡرَأَ سَوۡءٖ وَمَا كَانَتۡ أُمُّكِ بَغِيّٗا
TRANSLATION: (28) O sister [i.e., descendant] of Aaron, your father was not a man of evil, nor was your mother unchaste."

ARABIC_TEXT: فَأَشَارَتۡ إِلَيۡهِۖ قَالُواْ كَيۡفَ نُكَلِّمُ مَن كَانَ فِي ٱلۡمَهۡدِ صَبِيّٗا
TRANSLATION: (29) So she pointed to him. They said, "How can we speak to one who is in the cradle a child?"

ARABIC_TEXT: قَالَ إِنِّي عَبۡدُ ٱللَّهِ ءَاتَىٰنِيَ ٱلۡكِتَٰبَ وَجَعَلَنِي نَبِيّٗا
TRANSLATION: (30) [Jesus] said, "Indeed, I am the servant of Allāh. He has given me the Scripture and made me a prophet.

ARABIC_TEXT: وَجَعَلَنِي مُبَارَكًا أَيۡنَ مَا كُنتُ وَأَوۡصَٰنِي بِٱلصَّلَوٰةِ وَٱلزَّكَوٰةِ مَا دُمۡتُ حَيّٗا
TRANSLATION: (31) And He has made me blessed wherever I am and has enjoined upon me prayer and zakāh as long as I remain alive

ARABIC_TEXT: وَبَرَّۢا بِوَٰلِدَتِي وَلَمۡ يَجۡعَلۡنِي جَبَّارٗا شَقِيّٗا
TRANSLATION: (32) And [made me] dutiful to my mother, and He has not made me a wretched tyrant.

ARABIC_TEXT: وَٱلسَّلَٰمُ عَلَيَّ يَوۡمَ وُلِدتُّ وَيَوۡمَ أَمُوتُ وَيَوۡمَ أُبۡعَثُ حَيّٗا
TRANSLATION: (33) And peace is on me the day I was born and the day I will die and the day I am raised alive."

ARABIC_TEXT: ذَٰلِكَ عِيسَى ٱبۡنُ مَرۡيَمَۖ قَوۡلَ ٱلۡحَقِّ ٱلَّذِي فِيهِ يَمۡتَرُونَ
TRANSLATION: (34) That is Jesus, the son of Mary - the word of truth about which they are in dispute.

ARABIC_TEXT: مَا كَانَ لِلَّهِ أَن يَتَّخِذَ مِن وَلَدٖۖ سُبۡحَٰنَهُۥٓۚ إِذَا قَضَىٰٓ أَمۡرٗا فَإِنَّمَا يَقُولُ لَهُۥ كُن فَيَكُونُ
TRANSLATION: (35) It is not [befitting] for Allāh to take a son; exalted is He![813] When He decrees an affair, He only says to it, "Be," and it is.
FOOTNOTES: [813]- i.e., far removed is He from any such need.

ARABIC_TEXT: وَإِنَّ ٱللَّهَ رَبِّي وَرَبُّكُمۡ فَٱعۡبُدُوهُۚ هَٰذَا صِرَٰطٞ مُّسۡتَقِيمٞ
TRANSLATION: (36) [Jesus said], "And indeed, Allāh is my Lord and your Lord, so worship Him. That is a straight path."

ARABIC_TEXT: فَٱخۡتَلَفَ ٱلۡأَحۡزَابُ مِنۢ بَيۡنِهِمۡۖ فَوَيۡلٞ لِّلَّذِينَ كَفَرُواْ مِن مَّشۡهَدِ يَوۡمٍ عَظِيمٍ
TRANSLATION: (37) Then the factions differed [concerning Jesus] from among them, so woe to those who disbelieved - from the scene of a tremendous Day.

ARABIC_TEXT: أَسۡمِعۡ بِهِمۡ وَأَبۡصِرۡ يَوۡمَ يَأۡتُونَنَا لَٰكِنِ ٱلظَّٰلِمُونَ ٱلۡيَوۡمَ فِي ضَلَٰلٖ مُّبِينٖ
TRANSLATION: (38) How [clearly] they will hear and see the Day they come to Us, but the wrongdoers today are in clear error.

ARABIC_TEXT: وَأَنذِرۡهُمۡ يَوۡمَ ٱلۡحَسۡرَةِ إِذۡ قُضِيَ ٱلۡأَمۡرُ وَهُمۡ فِي غَفۡلَةٖ وَهُمۡ لَا يُؤۡمِنُونَ
TRANSLATION: (39) And warn them, [O Muḥammad], of the Day of Regret, when the matter will be concluded;[814] and [yet], they are in [a state of] heedlessness, and they do not believe.
FOOTNOTES: [814]- i.e., "judged" or "accomplished."

ARABIC_TEXT: إِنَّا نَحۡنُ نَرِثُ ٱلۡأَرۡضَ وَمَنۡ عَلَيۡهَا وَإِلَيۡنَا يُرۡجَعُونَ
TRANSLATION: (40) Indeed, it is We who will inherit the earth and whoever is on it, and to Us they will be returned.

ARABIC_TEXT: وَٱذۡكُرۡ فِي ٱلۡكِتَٰبِ إِبۡرَٰهِيمَۚ إِنَّهُۥ كَانَ صِدِّيقٗا نَّبِيًّا
TRANSLATION: (41) And mention in the Book [the story of] Abraham. Indeed, he was a man of truth and a prophet.

ARABIC_TEXT: إِذۡ قَالَ لِأَبِيهِ يَٰٓأَبَتِ لِمَ تَعۡبُدُ مَا لَا يَسۡمَعُ وَلَا يُبۡصِرُ وَلَا يُغۡنِي عَنكَ شَيۡـٔٗا
TRANSLATION: (42) [Mention] when he said to his father, "O my father, why do you worship that which does not hear and does not see and will not benefit you at all?

ARABIC_TEXT: يَٰٓأَبَتِ إِنِّي قَدۡ جَآءَنِي مِنَ ٱلۡعِلۡمِ مَا لَمۡ يَأۡتِكَ فَٱتَّبِعۡنِيٓ أَهۡدِكَ صِرَٰطٗا سَوِيّٗا
TRANSLATION: (43) O my father, indeed there has come to me of knowledge that which has not come to you, so follow me; I will guide you to an even path.

ARABIC_TEXT: يَٰٓأَبَتِ لَا تَعۡبُدِ ٱلشَّيۡطَٰنَۖ إِنَّ ٱلشَّيۡطَٰنَ كَانَ لِلرَّحۡمَٰنِ عَصِيّٗا
TRANSLATION: (44) O my father, do not worship [i.e., obey] Satan. Indeed Satan has ever been, to the Most Merciful, disobedient.

ARABIC_TEXT: يَٰٓأَبَتِ إِنِّيٓ أَخَافُ أَن يَمَسَّكَ عَذَابٞ مِّنَ ٱلرَّحۡمَٰنِ فَتَكُونَ لِلشَّيۡطَٰنِ وَلِيّٗا
TRANSLATION: (45) O my father, indeed I fear that there will touch you a punishment from the Most Merciful so you would be to Satan a companion [in Hellfire]."

ARABIC_TEXT: قَالَ أَرَاغِبٌ أَنتَ عَنۡ ءَالِهَتِي يَٰٓإِبۡرَٰهِيمُۖ لَئِن لَّمۡ تَنتَهِ لَأَرۡجُمَنَّكَۖ وَٱهۡجُرۡنِي مَلِيّٗا
TRANSLATION: (46) [His father] said, "Have you no desire for my gods, O Abraham? If you do not desist, I will surely stone you, so avoid me a prolonged time."

ARABIC_TEXT: قَالَ سَلَٰمٌ عَلَيۡكَۖ سَأَسۡتَغۡفِرُ لَكَ رَبِّيٓۖ إِنَّهُۥ كَانَ بِي حَفِيّٗا
TRANSLATION: (47) [Abraham] said, "Peace [i.e., safety] will be upon you.[815] I will ask forgiveness for you of my Lord. Indeed, He is ever gracious to me.
FOOTNOTES: [815]- Meaning "You are secure" or "I will not harm you."

ARABIC_TEXT: وَأَعۡتَزِلُكُمۡ وَمَا تَدۡعُونَ مِن دُونِ ٱللَّهِ وَأَدۡعُواْ رَبِّي عَسَىٰٓ أَلَّآ أَكُونَ بِدُعَآءِ رَبِّي شَقِيّٗا
TRANSLATION: (48) And I will leave you and those you invoke other than Allāh and will invoke[816] my Lord. I expect that I will not be in invocation to my Lord unhappy [i.e., disappointed]."
FOOTNOTES: [816]- i.e., worship.

ARABIC_TEXT: فَلَمَّا ٱعۡتَزَلَهُمۡ وَمَا يَعۡبُدُونَ مِن دُونِ ٱللَّهِ وَهَبۡنَا لَهُۥٓ إِسۡحَٰقَ وَيَعۡقُوبَۖ وَكُلّٗا جَعَلۡنَا نَبِيّٗا
TRANSLATION: (49) So when he had left them and those they worshipped other than Allāh, We gave him Isaac and Jacob, and each [of them] We made a prophet.

ARABIC_TEXT: وَوَهَبۡنَا لَهُم مِّن رَّحۡمَتِنَا وَجَعَلۡنَا لَهُمۡ لِسَانَ صِدۡقٍ عَلِيّٗا
TRANSLATION: (50) And We gave them of Our mercy, and We made for them a mention [i.e., reputation] of high honor.

ARABIC_TEXT: وَٱذۡكُرۡ فِي ٱلۡكِتَٰبِ مُوسَىٰٓۚ إِنَّهُۥ كَانَ مُخۡلَصٗا وَكَانَ رَسُولٗا نَّبِيّٗا
TRANSLATION: (51) And mention in the Book, Moses. Indeed, he was chosen, and he was a messenger and a prophet.[817]
FOOTNOTES: [817]- A messenger (rasūl) is one who was charged by Allāh to reform society.  A prophet (nabī) is one who received revelation from Allāh, the latter being more numerous than the former.

ARABIC_TEXT: وَنَٰدَيۡنَٰهُ مِن جَانِبِ ٱلطُّورِ ٱلۡأَيۡمَنِ وَقَرَّبۡنَٰهُ نَجِيّٗا
TRANSLATION: (52) And We called him from the side of the mount[818] at [his] right and brought him near, confiding [to him].
FOOTNOTES: [818]- Mount Sinai.

ARABIC_TEXT: وَوَهَبۡنَا لَهُۥ مِن رَّحۡمَتِنَآ أَخَاهُ هَٰرُونَ نَبِيّٗا
TRANSLATION: (53) And We gave him out of Our mercy his brother Aaron as a prophet.

ARABIC_TEXT: وَٱذۡكُرۡ فِي ٱلۡكِتَٰبِ إِسۡمَٰعِيلَۚ إِنَّهُۥ كَانَ صَادِقَ ٱلۡوَعۡدِ وَكَانَ رَسُولٗا نَّبِيّٗا
TRANSLATION: (54) And mention in the Book, Ishmael. Indeed, he was true to his promise, and he was a messenger and a prophet.

ARABIC_TEXT: وَكَانَ يَأۡمُرُ أَهۡلَهُۥ بِٱلصَّلَوٰةِ وَٱلزَّكَوٰةِ وَكَانَ عِندَ رَبِّهِۦ مَرۡضِيّٗا
TRANSLATION: (55) And he used to enjoin on his people prayer and zakāh and was to his Lord pleasing [i.e., accepted by Him].

ARABIC_TEXT: وَٱذۡكُرۡ فِي ٱلۡكِتَٰبِ إِدۡرِيسَۚ إِنَّهُۥ كَانَ صِدِّيقٗا نَّبِيّٗا
TRANSLATION: (56) And mention in the Book, Idrees. Indeed, he was a man of truth and a prophet.

ARABIC_TEXT: وَرَفَعۡنَٰهُ مَكَانًا عَلِيًّا
TRANSLATION: (57) And We raised him to a high station.

ARABIC_TEXT: أُوْلَٰٓئِكَ ٱلَّذِينَ أَنۡعَمَ ٱللَّهُ عَلَيۡهِم مِّنَ ٱلنَّبِيِّـۧنَ مِن ذُرِّيَّةِ ءَادَمَ وَمِمَّنۡ حَمَلۡنَا مَعَ نُوحٖ وَمِن ذُرِّيَّةِ إِبۡرَٰهِيمَ وَإِسۡرَٰٓءِيلَ وَمِمَّنۡ هَدَيۡنَا وَٱجۡتَبَيۡنَآۚ إِذَا تُتۡلَىٰ عَلَيۡهِمۡ ءَايَٰتُ ٱلرَّحۡمَٰنِ خَرُّواْۤ سُجَّدٗاۤ وَبُكِيّٗا۩
TRANSLATION: (58) Those were the ones upon whom Allāh bestowed favor from among the prophets of the descendants of Adam and of those We carried [in the ship] with Noah, and of the descendants of Abraham and Israel [i.e., Jacob], and of those whom We guided and chose. When the verses of the Most Merciful were recited to them, they fell in prostration and weeping.

ARABIC_TEXT: ۞ فَخَلَفَ مِنۢ بَعۡدِهِمۡ خَلۡفٌ أَضَاعُواْ ٱلصَّلَوٰةَ وَٱتَّبَعُواْ ٱلشَّهَوَٰتِۖ فَسَوۡفَ يَلۡقَوۡنَ غَيًّا
TRANSLATION: (59) But there came after them successors [i.e., later generations] who neglected prayer and pursued desires; so they are going to meet evil[819] -
FOOTNOTES: [819]- Described as a valley in Hell or may be rendered "the consequence of error."

ARABIC_TEXT: إِلَّا مَن تَابَ وَءَامَنَ وَعَمِلَ صَٰلِحٗا فَأُوْلَٰٓئِكَ يَدۡخُلُونَ ٱلۡجَنَّةَ وَلَا يُظۡلَمُونَ شَيۡـٔٗا
TRANSLATION: (60) Except those who repent, believe and do righteousness; for those will enter Paradise and will not be wronged at all.

ARABIC_TEXT: جَنَّٰتِ عَدۡنٍ ٱلَّتِي وَعَدَ ٱلرَّحۡمَٰنُ عِبَادَهُۥ بِٱلۡغَيۡبِۚ إِنَّهُۥ كَانَ وَعۡدُهُۥ مَأۡتِيّٗا
TRANSLATION: (61) [Therein are] gardens of perpetual residence which the Most Merciful has promised His servants in the unseen. Indeed, His promise has ever been eminent.[820]
FOOTNOTES: [820]- Literally, "that to which all will come."

ARABIC_TEXT: لَّا يَسۡمَعُونَ فِيهَا لَغۡوًا إِلَّا سَلَٰمٗاۖ وَلَهُمۡ رِزۡقُهُمۡ فِيهَا بُكۡرَةٗ وَعَشِيّٗا
TRANSLATION: (62) They will not hear therein any ill speech - only [greetings of] peace - and they will have their provision therein, morning and afternoon.

ARABIC_TEXT: تِلۡكَ ٱلۡجَنَّةُ ٱلَّتِي نُورِثُ مِنۡ عِبَادِنَا مَن كَانَ تَقِيّٗا
TRANSLATION: (63) That is Paradise, which We give as inheritance to those of Our servants who were fearing of Allāh.

ARABIC_TEXT: وَمَا نَتَنَزَّلُ إِلَّا بِأَمۡرِ رَبِّكَۖ لَهُۥ مَا بَيۡنَ أَيۡدِينَا وَمَا خَلۡفَنَا وَمَا بَيۡنَ ذَٰلِكَۚ وَمَا كَانَ رَبُّكَ نَسِيّٗا
TRANSLATION: (64) [Gabriel said],[821] "And we [angels] descend not except by the order of your Lord. To Him belongs that before us and that behind us and what is in between. And never is your Lord forgetful -
FOOTNOTES: [821]- In answer to the Prophet's wish that Gabriel would visit him more often.

ARABIC_TEXT: رَّبُّ ٱلسَّمَٰوَٰتِ وَٱلۡأَرۡضِ وَمَا بَيۡنَهُمَا فَٱعۡبُدۡهُ وَٱصۡطَبِرۡ لِعِبَٰدَتِهِۦۚ هَلۡ تَعۡلَمُ لَهُۥ سَمِيّٗا
TRANSLATION: (65) Lord of the heavens and the earth and whatever is between them - so worship Him and have patience for His worship. Do you know of any similarity to Him?"

ARABIC_TEXT: وَيَقُولُ ٱلۡإِنسَٰنُ أَءِذَا مَا مِتُّ لَسَوۡفَ أُخۡرَجُ حَيًّا
TRANSLATION: (66) And man [i.e., the disbeliever] says, "When I have died, am I going to be brought forth alive?"

ARABIC_TEXT: أَوَلَا يَذۡكُرُ ٱلۡإِنسَٰنُ أَنَّا خَلَقۡنَٰهُ مِن قَبۡلُ وَلَمۡ يَكُ شَيۡـٔٗا
TRANSLATION: (67) Does man not remember that We created him before, while he was nothing?

ARABIC_TEXT: فَوَرَبِّكَ لَنَحۡشُرَنَّهُمۡ وَٱلشَّيَٰطِينَ ثُمَّ لَنُحۡضِرَنَّهُمۡ حَوۡلَ جَهَنَّمَ جِثِيّٗا
TRANSLATION: (68) So by your Lord, We will surely gather them and the devils; then We will bring them to be present around Hell upon their knees.[822]
FOOTNOTES: [822]- i.e., fallen on their knees from terror or dragged there unwillingly on their knees.

ARABIC_TEXT: ثُمَّ لَنَنزِعَنَّ مِن كُلِّ شِيعَةٍ أَيُّهُمۡ أَشَدُّ عَلَى ٱلرَّحۡمَٰنِ عِتِيّٗا
TRANSLATION: (69) Then We will surely extract from every sect those of them who were worst against the Most Merciful in insolence.

ARABIC_TEXT: ثُمَّ لَنَحۡنُ أَعۡلَمُ بِٱلَّذِينَ هُمۡ أَوۡلَىٰ بِهَا صِلِيّٗا
TRANSLATION: (70) Then, surely it is We who are most knowing of those most worthy of burning therein.

ARABIC_TEXT: وَإِن مِّنكُمۡ إِلَّا وَارِدُهَاۚ كَانَ عَلَىٰ رَبِّكَ حَتۡمٗا مَّقۡضِيّٗا
TRANSLATION: (71) And there is none of you except he will come to it.[823] This is upon your Lord an inevitability decreed.
FOOTNOTES: [823]- i.e., be exposed to it.  However, the people of Paradise will not be harmed thereby.

ARABIC_TEXT: ثُمَّ نُنَجِّي ٱلَّذِينَ ٱتَّقَواْ وَّنَذَرُ ٱلظَّٰلِمِينَ فِيهَا جِثِيّٗا
TRANSLATION: (72) Then We will save those who feared Allāh and leave the wrongdoers within it, on their knees.

ARABIC_TEXT: وَإِذَا تُتۡلَىٰ عَلَيۡهِمۡ ءَايَٰتُنَا بَيِّنَٰتٖ قَالَ ٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُواْ لِلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوٓاْ أَيُّ ٱلۡفَرِيقَيۡنِ خَيۡرٞ مَّقَامٗا وَأَحۡسَنُ نَدِيّٗا
TRANSLATION: (73) And when Our verses are recited to them as clear evidences, those who disbelieve say to those who believe, "Which of [our] two parties is best in position and best in association?"[824]
FOOTNOTES: [824]- In regard to worldly interests.

ARABIC_TEXT: وَكَمۡ أَهۡلَكۡنَا قَبۡلَهُم مِّن قَرۡنٍ هُمۡ أَحۡسَنُ أَثَٰثٗا وَرِءۡيٗا
TRANSLATION: (74) And how many a generation have We destroyed before them who were better in possessions and [outward] appearance?

ARABIC_TEXT: قُلۡ مَن كَانَ فِي ٱلضَّلَٰلَةِ فَلۡيَمۡدُدۡ لَهُ ٱلرَّحۡمَٰنُ مَدًّاۚ حَتَّىٰٓ إِذَا رَأَوۡاْ مَا يُوعَدُونَ إِمَّا ٱلۡعَذَابَ وَإِمَّا ٱلسَّاعَةَ فَسَيَعۡلَمُونَ مَنۡ هُوَ شَرّٞ مَّكَانٗا وَأَضۡعَفُ جُندٗا
TRANSLATION: (75) Say, "Whoever is in error - let the Most Merciful extend for him an extension [in wealth and time] until, when they see that which they were promised - either punishment [in this world] or the Hour [of resurrection] - they will come to know who is worst in position and weaker in soldiers."

ARABIC_TEXT: وَيَزِيدُ ٱللَّهُ ٱلَّذِينَ ٱهۡتَدَوۡاْ هُدٗىۗ وَٱلۡبَٰقِيَٰتُ ٱلصَّٰلِحَٰتُ خَيۡرٌ عِندَ رَبِّكَ ثَوَابٗا وَخَيۡرٞ مَّرَدًّا
TRANSLATION: (76) And Allāh increases those who were guided, in guidance, and the enduring good deeds are better to your Lord[825] for reward and better for recourse.
FOOTNOTES: [825]- i.e., in the sight or evaluation of Allāh.

ARABIC_TEXT: أَفَرَءَيۡتَ ٱلَّذِي كَفَرَ بِـَٔايَٰتِنَا وَقَالَ لَأُوتَيَنَّ مَالٗا وَوَلَدًا
TRANSLATION: (77) Then, have you seen he who disbelieved in Our verses and said, "I will surely be given wealth and children [in the next life]"?

ARABIC_TEXT: أَطَّلَعَ ٱلۡغَيۡبَ أَمِ ٱتَّخَذَ عِندَ ٱلرَّحۡمَٰنِ عَهۡدٗا
TRANSLATION: (78) Has he looked into the unseen, or has he taken from the Most Merciful a promise?

ARABIC_TEXT: كَلَّاۚ سَنَكۡتُبُ مَا يَقُولُ وَنَمُدُّ لَهُۥ مِنَ ٱلۡعَذَابِ مَدّٗا
TRANSLATION: (79) No! We will record what he says and extend [i.e., increase] for him from the punishment extensively.

ARABIC_TEXT: وَنَرِثُهُۥ مَا يَقُولُ وَيَأۡتِينَا فَرۡدٗا
TRANSLATION: (80) And We will inherit him [in] what he mentions,[826] and he will come to Us alone.
FOOTNOTES: [826]- Instead of giving him wealth and children in the Hereafter, Allāh will take from him those he had in worldly life at the time of his death.

ARABIC_TEXT: وَٱتَّخَذُواْ مِن دُونِ ٱللَّهِ ءَالِهَةٗ لِّيَكُونُواْ لَهُمۡ عِزّٗا
TRANSLATION: (81) And they have taken besides Allāh [false] deities that they would be for them [a source of] honor.

ARABIC_TEXT: كَلَّاۚ سَيَكۡفُرُونَ بِعِبَادَتِهِمۡ وَيَكُونُونَ عَلَيۡهِمۡ ضِدًّا
TRANSLATION: (82) No! They [i.e., those "gods"] will deny their worship of them and will be against them opponents [on the Day of Judgement].

ARABIC_TEXT: أَلَمۡ تَرَ أَنَّآ أَرۡسَلۡنَا ٱلشَّيَٰطِينَ عَلَى ٱلۡكَٰفِرِينَ تَؤُزُّهُمۡ أَزّٗا
TRANSLATION: (83) Do you not see that We have sent the devils upon the disbelievers, inciting them [to evil] with [constant] incitement?

ARABIC_TEXT: فَلَا تَعۡجَلۡ عَلَيۡهِمۡۖ إِنَّمَا نَعُدُّ لَهُمۡ عَدّٗا
TRANSLATION: (84) So be not impatient over them. We only count out [i.e., allow] to them a [limited] number.[827]
FOOTNOTES: [827]- Of breaths, of days, or of evil deeds.

ARABIC_TEXT: يَوۡمَ نَحۡشُرُ ٱلۡمُتَّقِينَ إِلَى ٱلرَّحۡمَٰنِ وَفۡدٗا
TRANSLATION: (85) On the Day We will gather the righteous to the Most Merciful as a delegation

ARABIC_TEXT: وَنَسُوقُ ٱلۡمُجۡرِمِينَ إِلَىٰ جَهَنَّمَ وِرۡدٗا
TRANSLATION: (86) And will drive the criminals to Hell in thirst

ARABIC_TEXT: لَّا يَمۡلِكُونَ ٱلشَّفَٰعَةَ إِلَّا مَنِ ٱتَّخَذَ عِندَ ٱلرَّحۡمَٰنِ عَهۡدٗا
TRANSLATION: (87) None will have [power of] intercession except he who had taken from the Most Merciful a covenant.[828]
FOOTNOTES: [828]- Not to worship other than Him.

ARABIC_TEXT: وَقَالُواْ ٱتَّخَذَ ٱلرَّحۡمَٰنُ وَلَدٗا
TRANSLATION: (88) And they say, "The Most Merciful has taken [for Himself] a son."

ARABIC_TEXT: لَّقَدۡ جِئۡتُمۡ شَيۡـًٔا إِدّٗا
TRANSLATION: (89) You have done an atrocious thing.

ARABIC_TEXT: تَكَادُ ٱلسَّمَٰوَٰتُ يَتَفَطَّرۡنَ مِنۡهُ وَتَنشَقُّ ٱلۡأَرۡضُ وَتَخِرُّ ٱلۡجِبَالُ هَدًّا
TRANSLATION: (90) The heavens almost rupture therefrom and the earth splits open and the mountains collapse in devastation

ARABIC_TEXT: أَن دَعَوۡاْ لِلرَّحۡمَٰنِ وَلَدٗا
TRANSLATION: (91) That they attribute to the Most Merciful a son.

ARABIC_TEXT: وَمَا يَنۢبَغِي لِلرَّحۡمَٰنِ أَن يَتَّخِذَ وَلَدًا
TRANSLATION: (92) And it is not appropriate for the Most Merciful that He should take a son.

ARABIC_TEXT: إِن كُلُّ مَن فِي ٱلسَّمَٰوَٰتِ وَٱلۡأَرۡضِ إِلَّآ ءَاتِي ٱلرَّحۡمَٰنِ عَبۡدٗا
TRANSLATION: (93) There is no one in the heavens and earth but that he comes to the Most Merciful as a servant.

ARABIC_TEXT: لَّقَدۡ أَحۡصَىٰهُمۡ وَعَدَّهُمۡ عَدّٗا
TRANSLATION: (94) He has enumerated them and counted them a [full] counting.

ARABIC_TEXT: وَكُلُّهُمۡ ءَاتِيهِ يَوۡمَ ٱلۡقِيَٰمَةِ فَرۡدًا
TRANSLATION: (95) And all of them are coming to Him on the Day of Resurrection alone.

ARABIC_TEXT: إِنَّ ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُواْ وَعَمِلُواْ ٱلصَّٰلِحَٰتِ سَيَجۡعَلُ لَهُمُ ٱلرَّحۡمَٰنُ وُدّٗا
TRANSLATION: (96) Indeed, those who have believed and done righteous deeds - the Most Merciful will appoint for them affection.[829]
FOOTNOTES: [829]- From Himself and from among each other.

ARABIC_TEXT: فَإِنَّمَا يَسَّرۡنَٰهُ بِلِسَانِكَ لِتُبَشِّرَ بِهِ ٱلۡمُتَّقِينَ وَتُنذِرَ بِهِۦ قَوۡمٗا لُّدّٗا
TRANSLATION: (97) So, [O Muḥammad], We have only made it [i.e., the Qur’ān] easy in your tongue [i.e., the Arabic language] that you may give good tidings thereby to the righteous and warn thereby a hostile people.

ARABIC_TEXT: وَكَمۡ أَهۡلَكۡنَا قَبۡلَهُم مِّن قَرۡنٍ هَلۡ تُحِسُّ مِنۡهُم مِّنۡ أَحَدٍ أَوۡ تَسۡمَعُ لَهُمۡ رِكۡزَۢا
TRANSLATION: (98) And how many have We destroyed before them of generations? Do you perceive of them anyone or hear from them a sound?
